issue.title: Handle cryptography

repository.name: python-telegram-bot
repository.description: We have made you a wrapper you can't refuse

issue.body:
seems like #2370 was too short-sighted as

* the cyclic imports apparently are back in 3.4.3, see pyca/cryptography#5794
* Building PTB via `setup.py` apparently fails as for some reason this tried to build cryptography from sources? At least [on RTD](https://readthedocs.org/projects/python-telegram-bot/builds/12968269/)
* There is currently a heavy discussion in progress in pyca/cryptography#5771 as apparently the usage of Rust code in v3.4 has broken CIs of a lot of people

We'll need to check out

* How this affects our building process
* How we can reasonably protect our users from install problems. Mind you, installation problems of 3rd party deps is not fully our problem, but if the majority of our users can't install it, then our package is worthless.

One could just pin cryptography to < 3.4 for starters and just wait a bit until the dust settles …

issue.title: Import serialization early to break cyclic import

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

body: Thanks, I've got a patch (soon to be a PR) and I think we'll do a point release for this.

issue.title: fixed a circular import error (due to type hints)

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

body:
Thanks for the tix

I'm erring a little on the side of caution here, but how can we be sure this is the only remaining place where we get an import error? (this is the 2nd same kind of problem for v 3.4)

We can't :-/ I'm not aware of any tool for robustly testing for these
conditions, if there is one we'd love to hear about it!

On Tue, Feb 9, 2021 at 10:45 AM Mat <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Thanks for the tix
>
> I'm erring a little on the side of caution here, but how can we be sure
> this is the only remaining place where we get an import error? (this is the
> 2nd same kind of problem for v 3.4)
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5794#issuecomment-776035527>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAAGBDBS2TRMWSZE4CH43DS6FKBTANCNFSM4XKNRGMQ>
> .
>


-- 
All that is necessary for evil to succeed is for good people to do nothing.

@alex here are some links for you:
* https://github.com/sanitizers/octomachinery/blob/master/tests/circular_imports_test.py
* https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/master/testing/test_meta.py
* https://twitter.com/codewithanthony/status/1229445110510735361

I think you could adapt this technique for cryptography. Keep in mind that this test may be rather slow so it may be helpful to use it with pytest-xdist.

Thanks! Would you mind filing a separate issue proposing we add that to our
CI?

On Tue, Feb 9, 2021 at 11:10 AM Sviatoslav Sydorenko <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

All that is necessary for evil to succeed is for good people to do nothing.

note that the current released version appears to contain another circular import:

```console
$ python3 -c 'import cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.dh'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/tmp/y/venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/primitives/asymmetric/dh.py", line 11, in <module>
    from cryptography.hazmat.primitives import serialization
  File "/tmp/y/venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/primitives/serialization/__init__.py", line 15, in <module>
    from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.serialization.base import (
  File "/tmp/y/venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/primitives/serialization/base.py", line 28, in <module>
    def load_pem_parameters(data: bytes, backend=None) -> dh.DHParameters:
AttributeError: partially initialized module 'cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.dh' has no attribute 'DHParameters' (most likely due to a circular import)
```
@asottile this looks like the same issue as the one the OP filed for this bug? It's fixed on master and will be in a point release soonish.
